samples.question: Which one is hard?
samples.transcript: Since I am working as a cabin crew. So we have this layover which is in Hanoi. And this lay over was special for me. The reason behind because Hanoi people are very nice. They know about the hospitality and in this hotel I cannot remember the name of the hotel because it is been long time but this hotel provide spa and massage facilities which are very nice and relaxing and the like the good thing is the rates the price is cheaper there. So if people go there to do spas, facial and all it will be worth also I have tried a dish in V. Now since I am vegetarian so I know I got very less option but it was a vegetable fried rice which gives different taste. I have tried many other fried rice in different country but this was the favorite one I had. And also if say about hotel staying. So the rooms are very nice. I must say they have very good interior in the room. very comfortable beds. and the view from my window was amazing. I was like looking like 10 minutes I sat on my window and looking the views outside and it is really nice to have this vacation at Hanoi. also about like working as a crew. my we must have one Vietnam language speaker on board. So he was help us to you know u taking us on layover outside the hotel. what is the thing we should do and everything he helped me in that.

samples.question: What things are most important when someone is choosing a hotel?
samples.transcript: The important thing is where this hotel is located and this hotel should be at least basic amenities a person should need it because it is very important you get rest well there. yes, those two things.
samples.transcript_original: The important thing is where this hotel is located and this hotel should be at least basic amenities a person should need it because it's very important you get rest well there. Uh yes, those two things.

samples.question: Why are there some people who really do not like staying in hotels?

samples.question: Any questions about that strategy?
samples.transcript: That is I would say I would have many option to speak on that topic. Now I realize it and and you will not be able to do this immediately. So you are going to go away and work on this. I would recommend doing maybe you know two or three times a day for a while until this strategy becomes second nature. So you are doing it as a habit. So like when we are tying our shoelaces, we do not think about tying our shoelaces. We just do it so many times. Or riding a bike. We do not think about riding a bike.

samples.question: So always listen to the question and think what do they want me to do?
samples.transcript: They always are giving you some kind of task in each question. So it could be compare two things or it could be talk about the past like for example what career did you want to do when you were a child or they might want to test can she talk about the future what career would you like to do in the future or they might ask about you know testing can you give your opinion what is your favorite this what is a popular so always think about what are they wanting me to do in this in this question and if you are not sure always say can you repeat the question or what do you mean by that instead of jumping in.
samples.transcript_original: They always are giving you some kind of task in each question. samples.transcript_cleaned: They always are giving you some kind of task in each question. samples.question: So, for example, do you think staying in an expensive hotel is a waste of money?
samples.transcript: You might think it is a waste of money. Other people would think that it is a very good investment and it is worth the money.
samples.transcript_original: You might think it's a waste of money. Other people would think that it's a very good investment and it's worth the money.
samples.transcript_cleaned: You might think it is a waste of money. Other people would think that it is a very good investment and it is worth the money.

samples.question: Why do some people agree with me and think that it is not so good?
samples.transcript: And then, okay, some people think that a luxury hotel is a good investment in money. For example, there is a lot of business people, they need to be looked after. They do not have time to you know, be thinking about pressing their clothes and what restaurant to go to and have any problems. They just need to be completely looked after. And for those people it is a good investment similar to business class travel.

They don't have time to um, you know, be thinking about pressing their clothes and what restaurant to go to and have any problems. They just need to be completely looked after. And for those people it is a good investment similar to business class travel.

They do not have time to you know, be thinking about pressing their clothes and what restaurant to go to and have any problems. They just need to be completely looked after. And for those people it is a good investment similar to business class travel.

samples.question: What is your favorite type of cuisine?
samples.transcript: Well, I have to say that I am not a picky eater.
samples.transcript_original: Well, uh, I have to say that I'm not a picky eater.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I have to say that I am not a picky eater.

samples.question: So, if I have to pick the my favorite food, did you hear that?
samples.transcript: I am not a picky eater. Beautiful. Very natural phrase that native speakers use. And we have got off to a great start. It says Vietnamese food because we are all familiar with the traditional food in Vietnam and I find that it contains a variety of food. So, I think that it will give me a tasty meal when it comes to Vietnamese cuisine. Fantastic. Thank you. I love that she smiles at the end of her answer. Guys, one piece of advice I would give you is when you finish speaking, try to finish confidently with a smile ready for the next question. It just helps for that communication between the student and the examiner.

samples.question: When I was young, I preferred junk food and I can ate it all day and eat it all day.
samples.transcript: Good selfcorrection there straight away. Excellent. Eat and eat. but when I am I have grown older, I think that healthy meal is very important. And then I have changed to a more healthier lifestyle like eating more vegetables and I fruits like I think. Brilliant. One thing, Ni used a fantastic technique there. She said, "When I was younger, but now." that is really nice because we show we can use the past tense and the present tense. Excellent.

She said, "When I was younger, but now." That's really nice because we show we can use the past tense and the present tense. Excellent.

samples.question: But is there any food you dislike?
